values:
That's all, just dissatisfied.
I have a roof over my head, clothes on my back and food in my fridge.
My dogs are pretty cute too.

I'm still fucking dissatisfied.

Here's what I want humanity to do:
Follow through on your promises. (so, don't promise what you can't, or won't, deliver.)
Communicate.
Treat people with respect.
Don't talk to me like I'm a fucking idiot.
Don't tell me how to run my business.
Pay your debts.
Shut the fuck up.

Yesh, starting a restaurant is zany & stressful and I can't even begin to have control, organization or focus in my life right now.  For visual updates go here. 

The Shanty opens a week from today, Tuesday April 1st.

I'll post more when I have some free time. 

Yeah, right.

Peace.
I hope this doesn't happen at the Shanty!

An Omen?  (or two?)

I was going to write in this space about how excited I am about our purchase of the Shanty and about our plans for the next few months.

It was official at about 7pm on Friday evening - we all went to our lawyers office and signed a TON of papers, in triplicate, and then initialed the corner of each and every page just to be sure.  The plan was to then go out to the Grapevine, as we had just received a gift certificate thereto, and celebrate.  Alas!  I had (still have) a horrible cough, chills and a fever - so we were just going to go home.  The boys who were selling us the joint ( Ok, just one of them) really had his heart set on a toast to seal the deal, so we all went to Major Magleashes and ordered a round.  I ordered a Jack & Ginger 'cuz of my sore throat and cough, little did I know it would come in a pint glass with a straw.  Now, I'm the kinda girl who orders her cosmos in a rocks glass because martini glasses are too unstable for me.  I'm sick, I'm shivering, I whack the straw and send that full icy pint of boozy goodness Right Onto My Crotch!  As if I weren't already cold enough....  So, Major's was filled with displaced Shanty regulars, and no fewer than three Shanty employees - embarrassed and miserable?  Nope, not me....ok, me.  They were kind enough to give me a refill and a rag  (Yes, someone even made a joke about me being on the rag.  Sadly, I was too weak to bludgeon him to death.)  The owners of Majors have been great friends of the Shanty over the years, I'm glad to see the good will continue.  I promised not to spill anymore drinks on their rug...

Now, we had been at the Shanty all week, cleaning, measuring, packing things up and throwing things away.  RCG, a local developer,  is currently tearing down the old Salem Evening News building right behind us.  The last wall standing is about 7 feet from our back wall, so to tear it down they are parking a giant cherry picker in front of our building and reaching over us to horizontally jack-hammer away sections of brick and rebar.  It makes the place shake and shimmy and it's pretty noisy.  I've been waiting to get a phone call from RCG saying that they knocked a hole in our roof or some other such rot.  I've posted our cell phone numbers on both doors of the place, in case they need to reach us pronto.  The morning of the sale I called an insurance agent, just to get things started.  I've left all of the other calls, utilities, vendors etc. for Tuesday morning since Monday is MLK day and most office workers have the day off. 

Aaaah, three day weekend, a 'fridge full of food, plenty of cold medicine, a pile of DVD's to watch (Thanks, Kev!) and nothing I can officially do until Tuesday anyway.  I'm gonna git me some rest!!!  Sunday night, I eat a big ol' sandwich, watch an awesome Coen Brothers movie and go to bed around 11pm.  I brush, take my vitamins, some cold medicine and a sleeping pill, I bring my cell phone into the bedroom and put it on my bed table, insert my trusty ear plug and hit the sack.

Heaven!  I sleep until almost noon on Monday, awesome!  If you don't count the tossing and turning when the dogs moved or the Hubz snored I slept for 13 hours!  I still felt like I needed more, I was drenched with sweat and my head was all spinny.  I looked over at my phone and saw "4 missed calls" I glanced at the list figuring it was my family who always calls me early in the day - as if I were a real person.  One of the calls came from inside the Lobster Shanty at 12:05AM!!!!  ok, I roll over, Hubz is still right next to me, where he has been all night.  Who. The. Fuck. Was. In. The. Shanty?!  Using our phone, no less!!!!! I listen to the voice mail - it's one of the former owners (who's name, of course, is still on everything, such as the alarm company's emergency call list as well as the police's) telling me that there was an attempted break-in and asking me if the lock 'was supposed to look this way' and informing me that he told the alarm company to "ignore sector one alarms" (the f**king front door!) because it was probably the wind. 

I'm now playing this on speaker phone, so that the Hubz can hear it too and so I have my hands free to get dressed so I can rush right down there.  I call the guy back, twelve hours later, to find out what happened.  He pretends to not know what the lock used to look like, and thinks it was nothing serious.  I get in the car and head over, now the Hubz is feeling really sick so I ask his brother to join me 'cuz I'm a bit nervous about going alone....   Obvious signs that someone has tried to pry the hasp and padlock off the front door, obvious! - it was hard to even unlock the darn thing.  I hammered it back into place and made it flush with the door again - tomorrow I'll replace it with a whole new hasp set-up.  (Not that there was anything in there for them to steal.  We even removed the empty cash register.  No money, no food, (no heat) and only a few half-empty booze bottles.)  What we really need, though, is a new door.  A year or two ago the fire alarm was tripped and the fire dept. came over and crow-barred the doors open (even though there was no smoke showing) and wrenched the whole frame out of alignment.  The whole mess is pretty wonky anyway.  However, we need to get new doors approved by the city - we can't just replace them without asking The Man.  I'm wondering if they come in cast-iron.
Anyway, I call the police to follow up - even the dispatcher thinks it was the wind.  I'm just grateful that our Wicked Loud Alarm and our Super Lame Locks prevented them from actually getting in.

Ok, home again, made some tea - lots of honey, got my book, and a 'warm foot' sleeping bag and I'm ready for that rest.  Phone rings, it's my awesome brother in law (my sister's hubz) who has been gracious enough to offer and help us with carpentry stuff.  He wants to go in and measure things and talk about plans for the work he's scheduled to do on Wednesday.  I told him I'd be totally flexible to his schedule since he's doing us a favor and his hours are crazy-busy; now's the time so off I go.  Luckily, while we were there two cops come by to inspect the hasp - I tell them I've already hammered it back into place.  They tell me to replace our crappy front doors as soon as we can and that it was probably the wind.  Perhaps the Hubz and I should take turns sleeping behind the bar with a shot gun...

AAAAAAAAAAAIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!!!!!!!!!!  

We've only owned the place for 76 hours.  

I hope this gets easier.

Well, reliable sources (Bald Bill) say that New Year's Eve was the busiest that we've had in 5 years - I'm relatively pleased with the turnout.  I sold three times more food than I have any day since Thanksgiving. 

Sadly, no one got any of my lobster specials, except for my darling wife, Lychee, who had the lobster pie.

Some people drank too much, I did not.  I should have worn a  shirt that said "The Sober One" on it in giant letters.  I had champagne at midnight, that's it.

I wish I could have left the Shanty and gone over to my friend, Mrs. Chardonnay's house to celebrate her birthday with her - I hear I missed a great time.  Alas!  maybe next year.  I was glad that the Chardonnay entourage came to the Shanty for a few, but I wish I could have joined them.

I was cranky at the end of the night (mostly 'cause I was the sober one and everyone was annoying the crap out of me) - at one point in the evening, because I've had this horrible chest cold for over a week, I had a coughing fit.  The fit was bad, loud and icky so I went into the walk-in so no one would have to hear that coming from the kitchen.  Well, the combination of too much coffee, refrigerated air, and heavy coughing led me to pissing my pants.  Not a lot, a few teaspoons, but enough to really gross me out and make me uber-uncomfortable for the rest of the night.  I had to run to the bathroom, wash my undies in the sink and then wear wet panties all night.  And my dear husband wondered why I was so eager to get home after we shooed out the last customers at 1:30AM

Yup, that New Year's for you - I'm the sober one AND the only one to piss her pants.

When coffeesnob is all sad she has tons of time to write her woes on LJ, but when she's busy she doesn't have time for you (and is therefore happy because she is working hard and defines herself by her work which is a wholly American and unhealthy way of going through life)
Hel-lo run-on sentence! (although parenthetical)

OK Thanksgiving was up in the air: Did I order too many turkeys? (four, twelve-pounders) or not enough turkeys?  A nice fellow who received his requisite employer-gift-turkey gave us a frozen-like-a-rock number on Thanksgiving eve, which I promptly put into our delicious brine of orange juice, sage and molasses.  We started the day with five twelve pound birds and 8 or 10 flimsy promises of "stopping by" on  Thanksgiving, hopefully for dinner.
 
We try to get there by 9am but some crazy person scheduled a road race and didn't plan ahead with any traffic detours.  Um, the race went from the WIllows (near our home) down Essex Street (which connects our home to the rest of the world) at exactly that time.  So we sat, and sat, in turkey day traffic while crazy nut-bags ran, yes ran, for some noble goal at 9AM on THANKSGIVING.  I thought this was the one day, ONE DAY, when you didn't have to exercise or contemplate calorie burning.  arrrrrrrgh!

Anyway, we got the doors unlocked by 9:15am, which by the way is a ridiculous time to open a bar.  9:30, no customers, 9:45 no customers - where were ALL the people that promised that they needed a drink that early on Thanksgiving day?!  (aaaah, watching the loonies run, that's where!)

Into the smoker the turkeys went - filled with cranberries, fresh bay leaves and oranges.  I crossed my fingers and had a bloody Mary.

by 10am the bar (and my heart) were full; full of good, local regulars, families and employees happily watching the parade (oooh, Shrek!)  - the only time I've been comfortable with a six year old sitting at my bar.  We sold a good amount of bloodys, champagne and egg nog.

Bald Bill one of our long-time bartenders made a French-Canadian specialty called Gauton (or Caton, depending) that was essentially ground pork boiled for hours with fresh ground spices, onion and garlic - but it was more than that; it was fucking delicious!  Part pate, part stuffing and all nummy.  We put some out (cold) with crackers as an appetizer and then more on the table (warm) as stuffing at meal time.  He promised to make more for Christmas, I can't wait.

I had prepped my turkey stock (for gravy and stuffing), my mirepoix and roasted mushrooms (for stuffing) and my mashed potato ahead of time. I also had snipped, blanched and shocked my green beans (no haricot vert for this lot) and diced my butternut squash and onions.  Oh, and I made a dozen pies (four pumpkin, four squash with Grand Marnier and Captian Morgan and four sweet potato pecan pies with Jack Daniels macerated pecans).  I diced and toasted by bread for stuffing, put everything in the oven to warm or in the bain marie to hold hot and waited, and waited.

At 2pm dinner was served, my mom had stopped by to eat and was pressed into service.  I was weeded at 2:10 and stayed that way until about 4pm.  Most of my time was spent figuring out what the fuck I was doing - how do I keep the plates warm?  Where does the squash go?  What do you mean they don't want corn?  Where are the clean towels?  We need more large plates!  Where's my bloody Mary?  I put the gravy in a coffee urn and set it out on the table.  Yup, one big table in the middle of the Shanty, people came and went but that's what we did.

Suffice to say we sold out of turkey and we fed over 30 hungry people.  I took a bath on the price, $12 for a full meal, plus pie, plus seconds (only Ethel, my favorite waiter had seconds), but the good-will we created and the positive word-of-mouth that we generated were worth every penny, every burn on my flesh and every fretful moment.  People have been talking about it for days, people who work at other restaurants have come in after work to say "I hear you put out quite a spread for Thanksgiving, my customers were raving about it". 

Next year I'm going to take reservations and do it properly. 
This was only a test, had this been an actual Thanksgiving I would have been drunk by noon.

The only thing I am sad about is that more framily couldn't make it; some were busy, some were ill, all were missed.

Peace,
CS

Sigh...
Thursday.  Big night, new menu! brought in an extra waitress, prepped a TON of food.  Took my vitamins.
Served 12 people.
Did NOT kill myself.  Pushed the thought from my mind.

Ok, it was Thursday, weather was bad, no worries Friday will be better, usually a busier night anyway.
Friday Arrives. Opened early (we serve lunch on Fridays) brought in a waitress, ready ready ready.
Served 20 people... Paid bills, did payroll, cut the waitress early.
Did NOT kill myself.  Pushed the thought from my mind.

I will not slip into despair, even though I threw away 9 lob$ter$ today - they died because I ordered them two weeks ago and we haven't sold them since.
I will not slip into despair, even though my business partner FORGOT he was working today and I had to shut down everything and turn the alarm back on, lock up the restaurant and drive to go get him 10 minutes before we opened at Noon.
I will not slip into despair, even though all that rushing was for naught - our first customer didn't come in until 1:30PM and all he had was  beer.
I will not slip into despair, even though my next day off is Christmas Day.
I will not slip into despair.

OK, I received one of my two big deliveries to get ready for the new menu on Thursday.
I spent more money on food than I've made in food sales in the last few days.
I know you have to spend money to make money, but....
Ooooooooh, I hope I make enough to pay these invoices when they come due.

Today I only served 12 people, all day.   A mom and her daughter, a family of three, a take out order and then 6 people at the bar.  6 hours of standing around and 15 minutes of work.  Oy.   I hope this food investment gets people excited about eating at the Shanty again.

StressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStress
StressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStress
StressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStressStress

Now I'm going to go lie down at stare at my ceiling until it's time to get up tomorrow.

I'll thank Mother Nature now for the coffee that she gives to us mortals.

Peace.

Well, yesterday went pretty well.  Lee and I went in early to the Shanty, cleaned and scrubbed, organized and purged and then opened at 3pm.  Wednesdays are usually pretty slow, so our showing was not spectacular - just respectable.  Our first food sale was a cup of chowder to one of the ladies that runs a gallery on Artist's Row, or first beer sale was to Brother Kevin and our first booze sale was to Indian George, our most regular regular.

We saw a lot of familiar faces:  All the gallery ladies, and Gary (not a lady), Kevin, George, a gang of trivia fans who rang up a big tab, my wife, Michele, stopped by to visit, my sister brought 6 friends in her mommy group, both old owners stopped by, one brought his fiance, a few employees came in and some other regulars including Billy Willy - who won two squares in the football pool.  We also had a late night visit from Chef Paulie and both Starbucks Mike's. 

Since our awesome FOH manager, Rachel, hurt her foot Lee worked a double; Kevin was good enough to walk our dogs (we neglected the poor buggers all day).  Consequently there was no payroll to cover - it was the Dede & Lee show from open to close.  I'm tired, but I feel really good about all the stuff we accomplished.

Now I'm going to go have a nice hot cup of coffee.

Peace.

OK, we closed and did inventory yesterday. The guys took the last of their money from the register and from here on out... it's OURS!!!!

EEEEEEEEEEeeeeeeeeee!

*runs in a tight little circle, waving arms like she's covered with bees*

I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm Excited, I'm Scared,I'm tired.

Tentative new menu date: Thursday November 15th, 3pm 

Holy crap, I've got so much to do!  Why am I still writing on LJ?  Gotta go!

Peace.

This is what I'd be doing right now if I didn't feel so crappy.

Peace.

Salem is DEAD, there is NO ONE around. 
As much as that is bad for my bottom line, I feel a bit relieved.  I'm sick, I'm tired and I'm using this time to re-charge. 
On Wednesday we served about 2000 customers, today - about 200.  Oy.
(Now THIS is the ghost town the tourists will never see...ironic)

Looks like this coming Wednesday will be the first day of my Long Haul.  From that day forward if the kitchen is serving, I'll be the one serving.  No days off, no one to help me.  Flying solo, oh yeah!  I hope I'm more like RIchard Branson and less like Amelia Earhart.

Ok, another slug of NyQuil and back to bed with me.

Peace.

Urgh!
I knew it would happen.  I work a lot. I get a cold.  I'll all stuffed up and my throat is KILLING me.  

Today at work was really chill.  I got some baked beans ready for a charity thing for the YMCA.  the International Fiesta - it's an opportunity to get the Shanty's name out, show off my gram's beans and give to a good cause.  I hope it's fun.  I hope the weather doesn't ruin it.

One of my favorite old co-workers from Shubie's, Sheila, came by this afternoon with some friends.  The Shanty was so quiet it was great to have some very loud and very cheerful drunk ladies having a good time - it filled the place with life.  It was really nice to see and old chum too.  I'm wicked glad she came in.

My Mom and my Dad and his wife all stopped by today - it was swell to see the batch of them.  (Thanks for the bean pot, Dad!)

Things are all in flux at work, schedule-wise - new hours, different shifts - it's nutty.  We still have four people making decisions and it's getting really convoluted.  If all goes well we may be signing papers as early as this Thursday.  I'll keep you posted.   I can't wait until it's totally our show.  I know I'll make mistakes, but at least they will be mine.

Peace.

OK, yesterday was crazy.
I worked from 10 am until 2am today.  Ugh.

Today I went to work at 3pm, placed my orders, heated up the chowder and sat on my ass and drank three beers.
"Sorry folks, the kitchen is closed!"  are there any more beautiful words in the English Language?  Not today.

Our SBA loan was approved yesterday and we're getting the ball rolling to make all of this mischief official.

I

Can't

Wait!!!!

Well, I can smell change in the air. 

The kitchen (at the restaurant, oh no - not at home) is spotless and uber stocked and ready.  I've placed a giant food order to come in tomorrow morning and all kitchen staff (the four of us) will be in prepping and getting ready for Halloween.  It should be a very interesting 48 hours.  Because the weather is supposed to be nice we'll probably have a bunch of patio business - which means our restaurant will over double in size (from 48 seats to 112 seats).  I hope I'm ready.

Also, after the holiday the guys who are selling us the place will be leaving (mostly) and some changes are afoot.  I'll be putting together a new menu, probably on Monday November 5th.  Today I made the last batch of sweet corn bread as well as the last batch of collard greens; we'll discontinue them as soon as they sell out.  I'll probably replace the sweet stuff with a bacon & jalapeno cornbread.  I'll replace the collards with garlicky spinach with bacon.  Bacon, Bacon, Bacon!

Ok, off to bed I gotta be perky & spooky from now until November.

PS Happy Birthday Michele & Glen!!!
How did I come to this?
